hu.trigary.iodine.api.gui.element.base

Interface GuiTransparentable<T extends GuiTransparentable<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the class implementing this interface
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TextureGuiElement

    public interface GuiTransparentable<T extends GuiTransparentable<T>>
    Represents a GuiElement that can have transparency applied. Elements are opaque (non-transparent) by default.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getTransparencyComponent()
      Gets this element's current transparency as a value between 0x00 and 0xFF (both inclusive).
      default float getTransparencyPercentage()
      Gets this element's current transparency as a value between 0 and 1 (both inclusive).
      T setTransparencyComponent(int transparency)
      Sets this element's transparency.
      default T setTransparencyPercentage(float transparency)
      Sets this element's transparency.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransparencyPercentage

        @Contract(pure=true)
default float getTransparencyPercentage()
        Gets this element's current transparency as a value between 0 and 1 (both inclusive).
        Returns:
        the current transparency

      • getTransparencyComponent

        @Contract(pure=true)
int getTransparencyComponent()
        Gets this element's current transparency as a value between 0x00 and 0xFF (both inclusive).
        Returns:
        the current transparency

      • setTransparencyPercentage

        @NotNull
default T setTransparencyPercentage(float transparency)
        Sets this element's transparency. The value must be at least 0 and at most 1 (both inclusive).
        Parameters:
        transparency - the new transparency
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • setTransparencyComponent

        @NotNull
T setTransparencyComponent(int transparency)
        Sets this element's transparency. The value must be at least 0x00 and at most 0xFF (both inclusive).
        Parameters:
        transparency - the new transparency
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)
